addCard.title: Create Card
addCard.motivationText: Create question answer cards to reinforce your knowledge and accelerate your learning process.
addCard.question: Question
addCard.questionTooLong: Question cannot be longer than 500 characters
addCard.answerTooLong: Answer cannot be longer than 500 characters
addCard.csvUploadDescriptionFirst: Prepare your cards in Excel or Google Sheets as shown below and save them as CSV. Only the first two columns are required:
addCard.csvUploadDescriptionThird: Each row represents a card. Empty rows or missing required fields are skipped.
addCard.errorImport: An error occurred while adding cards:
addCard.csvUploadDescriptionMain: Prepare your cards in Excel or Google Sheets and save them as CSV. Upload your CSV file and your cards are ready!
addCard.tableStructure: The table can consist of 5 columns: 2 required and 3 optional. Columns:
addCard.requiredColumns: question and answer columns are required! example, note, image columns are optional.
addCard.imageInstructions: To add images to cards, you can give an image name to the image column of the row where you want to add an image (e.g., 'book'), then after uploading the CSV, you can upload the images and match them from the menu, or you can write an external URL (e.g., https://example.com/image.png) in the column and leave the upload to us.
addCard.svgNote: Note: SVG format is not supported.
addCard.svgWarningMessage: An SVG image was found on the card. These cards will be added without images.
addCard.selectImagesDescription: You can match the images you select with the image names specified in the CSV.

createDeck.title: Create Deck
createDeck.motivationText: Design your learning journey with personalized decks and master your knowledge.

howToCreate.title: How to Create?
howToCreate.intro: Follow the steps below to easily create a deck. Learn what each step does:
howToCreate.step1Desc: Give your deck a name. This name identifies your deck and appears in search results. E.g.: "English Words", "History Notes"
howToCreate.step2Desc: If your deck contains translations or matching, you can fill in the translation field. This field can be left empty. E.g.: For "English Words", the translation could be "Turkish Words".
howToCreate.step3Desc: You can describe the purpose, content, or usage of your deck. This information can be helpful for other users.
howToCreate.step4Desc: Select a category to determine what topic your deck belongs to. This makes it easier to discover and organize your deck.
howToCreate.step5Desc: After filling in all the information, press the "Create" button. After the deck is created, you can start adding cards.
howToCreate.step6Desc: Select the content language of your deck, up to a maximum of 2 languages. This makes it easier for other users to discover and organize your deck.
howToCreate.tip: Tip: After creating the deck, you can edit it or add cards anytime you want.

howToCreateCard.title: How to Create?
howToCreateCard.intro: Follow the steps below to easily create a card. Learn what each step does:
howToCreateCard.step1Desc: Write your card's question. This question will appear on the front of the card. E.g.: What is the Turkish translation of the word "Book"?
howToCreateCard.step2Desc: Write your card's answer. This answer will appear on the back of the card. E.g.: "Kitap"
howToCreateCard.step3Desc: You can add an example sentence or usage for your card. This field can be left empty. E.g.: "I am reading a book"
howToCreateCard.step4Desc: You can add additional notes or explanations for your card. This field can be left empty. E.g.: "This word is pronounced this way"
howToCreateCard.step5Desc: You can add an image to your card. This image can help with learning the card. This field can be left empty.
howToCreateCard.step6Desc: After filling in the question and answer fields, press the "Create Card" button. After the card is created, it will be added to your deck.
howToCreateCard.tip: Tip: After creating the card, you can edit or delete it anytime you want.
